item.title: “Stop trying to figure it out” – with John Assaraf
item.dc:creator: Tristan Truscott
item.description: "Stop trying to figure it out. It's already been done for you." - Now that's a phrase that everyone can appreciate! With all of our huge "to-do lists," there is something very comforting when someone tells us that they've "got it covered" and we don't need to worry about it. Well, we got reminded of [...]
item.content:encoded:
“Stop trying to figure it out. It’s already been done for you.” – Now that’s a phrase that everyone can appreciate!

With all of our huge “to-do lists,” there is something very comforting when someone tells us that they’ve “got it covered” and we don’t need to worry about it.  Well, we got reminded of that recently…

Not long ago Glen was filming an all-day live broadcast with some of the top experts in the personal development field… who also happen to be some of the most savvy entrepreneurs we know!

During one of the breaks, he managed to sneak out to film a quick video interview with one of these experts, John Assaraf, who has been on The Secret, Larry King Live and The Ellen Show and is someone we greatly admire as a friend and colleague.

In this quick video interview, John delivers some POWERFUL insights for those aspiring to be an abundant entrepreneur – and it revolves around us not having to do it all ourselves:
Prefer to read the highlights? Click the link at the bottom.

Wow!   So what do you think?  How would YOU answer that question?

Are you INTERESTED in achieving great success?  Or are you COMMITTED?

Sometimes on these self-inquiry type of questions, it’s hard to answer honestly – so we have to look at our ACTIONS.

Think about the situations in your own life that John brings up in his interview.  Which actions are you more likely to take?

The actions of someone that is interested?
Or the actions of someone that is committed?

It really got us thinking. How about you?

If you got an idea or had a reaction to the interview, please take a moment to comment below (and share as much detail as possible.) Not only because it means the world to us — we love knowing what we are doing is inspiring others — but more importantly, your comments, insights and ideas might really help someone else!

So many people come here looking for inspiration and ideas, and your unique insight or point of view may be that spark that someone needs in order to move forward in their own life or business.

Note: Please know that we greatly appreciate all of your thoughts and ideas but to try and cut down on people trying to spam our site, we automatically delete comments with links to websites or videos on other sites.

And THANK YOU for reading, watching and joining the conversation! We appreciate that everyone chooses to participate differently and we celebrate the uniqueness of the way that you choose to participate with us.

Looking to read highlights of the interview? Click Here
